item.title: Probability as a Generalisation of Boolean Algebra
item.description: A summary of Boolean algebra Given the following notations: a proposition is denoted as a lowercase letter, e.g. $p$, $q$ the truth value of a proposition $p$ is denoted as $ B(p) \in \set{0, 1} $, where $B(p)=1$ if $p$ is true or $B(p)=0$ if $p$ is false Negation (not) is defined as: $$ B(¬p) = 1 - B(p) $$ Conjunction (and) is defined as: $$ B(p∧q) = B(p) \times B(q) $$
